text: Hi! Me and my husband have been planning to go to Russia next summer, but since we also have a four year old daughter and I‚Äôm hearing all kinds of things (especially from western and Latvian(my home country)media) I am a bit nervous. But I have been in Russia some years before the war because I have some family there - my father‚Äôs uncle (basically my grandmother‚Äôs brother) has lived there almost all his life, married a Russian lady and has lived there since. He‚Äôs very old now and I wish to meet him because he‚Äôs the last living family member from that generation. But I‚Äôm very anxious because of safety and I could never travel anywhere with my daughter if I wouldn‚Äôt be 100% sure about safety. And I have heard authorities in Latvia saying that they could interrogate on the border or take your phone etc which sounds scary. But I‚Äôm so confused and don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs true or not because at the same time I see many people online saying that it‚Äôs really safe and they are travelling to Russia. My relatives live in Moscow by the way and my husband is Norwegian and my daughter has Norwegian passport. Do you think it‚Äôs safe for us to travel, I need some advice please üôè

author: @Igorinrussia

text: Hi. Take cash with you, exchange it in any exchanger (just do not shine the whole amount or a little), buy a SIM card and open an account in any Russian bank. All these procedures will take no more than 30 minutes in total. There is Tinkov Bank and Raifazen Bank, if I'm not mistaken, where you can open an account in advance in electronic form, but I do not know what will happen in six months

text: ¬†@Igorinrussia¬† The bus ticket with Ecolines was 5100 ruble. The price was the same going from Kaliningrad to Vilnius or all the way to Riga. The bus does not run daily. The flight with Aeroflot from Moscow to Kaliningrad was about 6500 ruble.

author: @panemanager

text: ¬†@FHM224¬† I don‚Äôt know much about travel in and out of this area. Do you know if it is possible for Canadians to travel this route?
author: @panemanager

text:
¬†@panemanager¬† The bus from Gdansk to Kaliningrad departs from Gdansk G≈Ç√≥wny (dworzec autobusowy) and takes 4 hours on the way to Kaliningrad.
There are 2 buses to Kaliningrad: 900 and 802. Tickets are purchased at the bus station.
You can get from Gdansk Airport to the Gdansk Bus Station by taxi, city bus or train
author: @artemprudnikov5693

text: ¬†@panemanager¬† there are no problems with entering the Russian Federation from Europe  but this is for now
author: @artemprudnikov5693

text: This is what I do as well. Fly into Germany and then catch bus (ecolines) from Germany to Kaliningrad. Fly from Kaliningrad to Moscow.

text: To open a bank account in Russia you will need a translated copy of your passport and a registration of where you are stopping.
author: @russianstuard2458

text: ¬†@russianstuard2458¬† Not translation was needed for me. Adress was only asked verbally. NO problems has occured with many poeple writing to me that theyve got one easily
author: @Igorinrussia

text: ¬†@Igorinrussia¬† When I lived in Russia only one bank allowed me to open an account without translated passport and that was Citibank but due to the costs of keeping that account i ended up changing to –ê–ª—å—Ñ–∞ –ë–∞–Ω–∫ but passport needed to be translated and needed immigration slip. 90% of the states banks will require passport translation. But for –ê–ª—å—Ñ–∞ and –±–∞–Ω–∫ —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ i know you need passport translated 100%

text:
Awesome! You will love it! Russian bank card - ofcourse you can and should take it with. If they will you that app onto your phone, you will be able to do other saving accoubts, make payments from germany if you wanna buy a ticket abroad in advance (way cheaper price tht way) etc. There is no ‚Äùsanctions‚Äù on transferring yiur personal bank cards even if they are russian :) .  Oh, and when you have next trip, and want to have internet as soon as you cross the border. Just make the monthly payment like on the same day when arriving next time to russia (its easy
Via your sberbank app)
